Comment: The process is called "Suspension of the Rules".  https://www.congressionalinstitute.org/112th-congress-house-floor-procedures-manual/viii-suspension-of-the-rules/  Bills normally require a lengthy process to get votes on, including lengthy floor debate, the ability to propose and vote on amendments, and a good while to actually cast a vote.  The majority leader may call for a bill to be passed under a suspension of the rules. This is normally done for bills that are expected to have broad support. This process bypasses the normal debate and amendment process for bills, and brings them quickly to a vote. Due to bypassing the normal rules, it requires 2/3 of the votes to pass.  It isn't an unusual act. In 2022, 301 of the 350 bills and resolutions that passed the House did so under a suspension of the rules.  https://www.progressivecaucuscenter.org/suspensions-117th-congress  It's normally a way to bring things to a vote you don't see value in wasting time on debating and going through the normal processes.
